Can i haz that OM with the blue stripe? I would do it myself, but the textures have gone full ******, and 90% of it is nonexistent, yet the textures work fine in ksp.

I think you just need to import .TGA in different way. It sounds like it is using the alpha-map for transparency on import.

Edited June 18, 2014 by Beale

Can i haz that OM with the blue stripe? I would do it myself, but the textures have gone full ******, and 90% of it is nonexistent, yet the textures work fine in ksp.

I had the same problem when I tried to convert the textures with Gimp, but I managed to convert them to .png without any problem using the trial version of photoshop.

Beale, the Salyut parts look great!

I had the same problem when I tried to convert the textures with Gimp, but I managed to convert them to .png without any problem using the trial version of photoshop.

Beale, the Salyut parts look great!

Hey thanks! They are coming along nicely

I must apologise about the .TGAs, I was wrong, they do not open correctly in GIMP, as it interprets the alpha channel as transparent without fail.

I am juggling work between MAC OSX and Windows 8, so I can't test it on all platforms at the moment.

Yes, Photoshop looks like what you need to load them correctly. Makes it a bit harder for folks to do what they will.

Though I can't take all requests for custom textures, how about I release .PNG versions of the plain white texture? That way people can add colour, dark, add decals, etc.

Then this can be saved as .TGA in any program.

I plan alternate textures for Salyut and LK also. I will choose unified colour schemes first (grey, green, white, -?- (not orange) ).

I would think that you would only have to do the IVA for the largest piece.

Very kind offer! But I kid really, IVAs are actually among my favourite things to do

I plan each piece to have a specialty, with appropriate things in the IVA (maybe it is dangerous to go this focused?)

Top node - control

middle node - battery, torque

bottom node - lab

engine - initially over-powered before hasty balancing update.

Thanks for these, great stuff.

This one in particular, the old 70s Terminals spread about gives a very kerbal look I think.

It looks a lot more roomy than I imagined for a small station, interesting.
am i stupid or do i miss somthing,but i dont know how to install

am i stupid or do i miss somthing,but i dont know how to install

How can I help?

In the file you download is called Tantares.7z (or something similar).

You use the program 7-Zip to extract this (into a new folder).

You find new folder called "Tantares".

Put this folder inside your "GameData" folder like all other mods.

Hope this helps .

Edited June 18, 2014 by Beale
ah,i figures it out,didnt have 7zip installed,thx
Yeah, Beale, about the textures, Could you just put one up here so I can drag and drop to my desktop? And about the Salyut/Vega, could you make special docking ports like with the actual soyuz?

oh my fu**ing Kod ... how could i missed this awesome Mod? Baele i love you ! finaly stock looking Soyuz parts ! I LOVE IT ! just took the beauty for a testride ony my stock Soyuz 2-3 lifter ... just awesome how clean the Tantares dits on a 1,25m lifter.

about the little offset CoM for RCS ... just place it a little bit more lower on the gridstructure, just underneath the decoupler and the problem is fixed (and it looks so more like teh real soyuz ^^ )

later i will show you somee Pics my Stock Soyuz together with Tantares
for reference, here is a 1.25m part with the RCS balls... it looks a bit big...
